Query: How to grep, excluding some patterns?

so_25781642: How to search for a pattern using grep and exclude another pattern
Top-3 Scripts:
so_25781642: grep -P 'http://\S*tt(?!p:)' file

grep -cP 'http://\S*tt(?!p:)' file

grep -P '(<=http://)?\S*tt(?!p:)' file

grep -oP '.*?\K(http:/)?/\S*tt(?!p:)\S*' file

grep -oP '.*?\Khttp://\S*tt(?!p:)\S*' file

so_52761146: while read -r line; do
    [[ $line =~ del && ! $line =~ ins ]] && printf '%s\n' "$line"
done < file
